references.paper_title: Exploring patterns enriched in a dataset with contrastive principal component analysis
references.reason: This paper introduces Contrastive Principal Component Analysis (CPCA), a foundational method for contrastive dimension reduction that is frequently referenced and extended upon in the current work.

references.paper_title: Unsupervised learning with contrastive latent variable models
references.reason: This paper introduces the Contrastive Latent Variable Model (CLVM), another important CDR method, providing a different approach to modeling contrastive data structures.
This paper extends CPCA by incorporating a probabilistic model, addressing limitations of CPCA and providing a more statistically rigorous framework for contrastive analysis.

references.paper_title: Isolating salient variations of interest in single-cell data with contrastivevi
references.reason: This paper introduces Contrastive Variational Inference (CVI), a deep learning-based CDR method that is shown to be effective in complex datasets, highlighting the power of advanced techniques in this area.

references.paper_title: Asymptotic theory for principal component analysis
references.reason: This paper provides fundamental asymptotic results for Principal Component Analysis (PCA), which are crucial for establishing consistency results and understanding the theoretical properties of dimension reduction methods.
